newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian shares mixed, some rise on political news.
newsitem.headline: Russian shares mixed, some rise on political news.

text.p: Leading Russian shares closed mixed on Friday and traders said they were waiting for foreign investors to define the trend for the next week.
Some investors were encouraged that an escalation in violence in Chechnya seemed to have been averted, dealers said.
The RTS-21 index edged up 0.67 percent to 182.07.

"The market is firmer today, but we have not seen flows from the West yet to substantiate these prices," said Nick Mokhoff, chief trader from Alliance-Menatep. "Hopefully next week we shall see some of these flows."
He said the market had firmed on news that a new ceasefire had been reached in Chechnya.
He also said that falling inflation rates had a positive impact on the share market.

Russian consumer prices fell 0.1 percent in the week to August 19 and if current trend continue August could be the first inflation-free month since 1992, the State Statistics Committee said on Thursday.
"All the indicators look very positive for Russia," Mokhoff said.
But he said it was still unclear how foreign investors would react.
"The most important thing right now is to see whether the West reacts well and whether the flows start going our way," Mokhoff said.
Andrei Galperin, a trader from Creditanalstalt-Grant, said prices would not fall any further.
"There is nowhere for the market to fall, as it has already corrected," he said. "There are quite a lot of domestic investors who buy at any decline in prices."
Mosenergo was traded at $0.97 at $0.960 at Thursday's close, UES rose to $0.0810 from $0.0804, LUKoil rose to $9.97 from $9.85 and Norilsk Nickel fell to $7.70 from $7.85.
